content.text:
# Lucille Lortel Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Musical

}}
The Lucille Lortel Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Musical was an award presented annually at the Lucille Lortel Awards to honor an actress for excellence in a leading role in an Off-Broadway musical production. The categories for lead performance were split into Outstanding Lead Actress in a Play and Outstanding Lead Actress in a Musical in 2014, before being retired in favor of gender-neutral categories in 2021.
Before the categories were split, several musical performers won or received nominations for the Lucille Lortel Award for Outstanding Lead Actor:
* Tonya Pinkins - 2004 winner for Caroline, Or Change
* Elaine Stritch - 2002 nominee for Elaine Stritch: At Liberty
* Jayne Houdyshell - - 2010 nominee for Coraline
* Sherie Rene Scott - 2010 nominee for Everyday Rapture
* Molly Ranson - 2012 nominee for Carrie
* Mary Testa - 2012 nominee for Queen of the Mist
